text: how long can you go without sleep
Elizabethan poets called it the certain
knot of peace there is no doubt that
sleep is very nice indeed
however the scientific community is
still a little hazy on what it's
actually for sleep is essential for all
complex animals even and in fact
especially including the Spanish even
dull-witted marine animals that need a
residual level of consciousness to
prevent them drowning or swimming onto
the beach can perform a trick called
unhea mystery
slow-wave sleep which means they shut
down one half of their brain while
allowing the other to remain conscious
without sleep all humans become
irritable unreasonable prone to making
erratic decisions such as going for a
kebab at 4 o'clock in the morning or
continuing to gamble despite mounting
losses and ruination casino owners know
this that's why there's never a clock or
any natural light anywhere near a
blackjack table
this helps to fool something called your
circadian rhythm bodily functions are
definitely affected by sleep or lack of
it
wounds heal faster when you're asleep
our white blood cell count decreases if
we miss sleep and this weakens the
immune system we secrete more anabolic
hormones when we sleep and these
stimulate protein synthesis helping our
muscles to grow sleep is essential to
forming and processing memories your
memories suffers if you're deprived of
sleep and this has been demonstrated by
numerous experiments of penniless
undergraduate students in return for
their money
sleep deprivation weakens resolve which
is why it's an effective form of torture
you'd expect all people to need the same
amount of sleep because for a given size
age and level of activity we all have
roughly the same requirements for oxygen
food and water but this isn't so
Margaret Thatcher the scourge of miners
and Argentinean battleships could
famously
get by on just four hours and night
while a typical teenage boy can sleep
for up to 17 hours a day waking up only
to masturbate and eat pizza
simultaneously in the animal kingdom
sleep requirements are closely related
to something called the base metabolic
rate or BMR rats have a very high BMR
and need around 14 hours a day elephants
have a very low BMR and they can get by
on around 3 an exception to this is the
domestic cat which sleeps for between 13
and 20 hours a day but that's because
cats are furry purring permanently
migrating household ornaments with no
function whatsoever so how long can you
go without nodding off well
healthy adults can consciously avoid
sleep for prolonged periods without
suffering any ill effects however
Guinness has studiously avoided
acknowledging any Records for sleep
deprivation presumably because no
adjudicator wants to stay awake long
enough to verify them but in 1964 a 17
year old American student named Randy
Gardner managed to stay awake for two
hundred and sixty-five hours or just
over 11 days this record was
subsequently broken although not
officially by a Cornishmen named Tony
Wright who managed to remain conscious
in a bar in Penzance for 266 hours
during the attempt he developed blisters
on his feet and he claimed that like a
dolphin or a whale
he'd mastered the art of unhex leap
shutting down one half of his brain at a
time he also reported seeing Pixies and
elves dancing around the place nothing
at all to do with being in a pub now

with a very interesting question can i
restructure my DNA to change into an
animal for example a skunk and if I can
will I retain my memories and my
knowledge of
things no for anyway for the answer to
other more comprehensible questions than
that why not subscribe the button is
somewhere on this screen in front of you
